item.title: The Vines Resort & Country Club introduces a new garden venue for meetings, incentives, conferences, and events
item.description:
Source: The Vines Resort & Country Club. The Pavilion. The Vines Resort & Country Club, located near Perth, Australia, has introduced “The Pavilion.” This new event space is a specially designed garden structure situated at the front of the resort, offering scenic views of the golf course and surrounding gardens. It’s an excellent choice for events such as conference gatherings or product launches. The open-air venue, capable of hosting 100 guests, has three sides open to the elements...

item.title: Small and medium-sized enterprises in Australia have the opportunity to utilize Microsoft Lync through iiNet
item.description:
Parallels, a company that provides platforms for delivering cloud services, has announced the successful deployment of Microsoft Lync through Parallels Automation at iiNet. iiNet is the second-largest DSL internet provider in Australia and a major competitor in the country’s telecommunications market. This new Microsoft Lync service from iiNet will provide small and medium enterprises (SMEs) across Australia with access to affordable, enterprise-grade voice, telephony, and video calling services. Source: iiNet website...

item.title: Etihad Airways now includes Melbourne as a destination for its A380 aircraft
item.description:
Etihad Airways has launched a new era of luxury air travel between Melbourne and Abu Dhabi with the introduction of the A380 superjumbo. This flagship aircraft, which features luxurious amenities like The Residence and next-generation cabins, will operate on one of the airline’s two daily flights between the cities, replacing a three-class Boeing 777-300ER. Passengers can enjoy innovative hospitality services during their flight, including a dedicated Butler, Inflight Chef, Flying Nanny, and Food and Beverage Managers...

item.title: Book appointments through Vaniday
item.description:
Source: Vaniday. Vaniday has been launched in Singapore. Vaniday, a platform for beauty and wellness services, has expanded to Singapore, its first market in Southeast Asia. The company recently secured €15 million in initial funding to support its growth. Vaniday wants to change how people find, book, and experience beauty and wellness services. The app and website allow users to browse a wide selection of salons and book appointments directly from the salon’s schedule...

item.title: The Australian government, in collaboration with Microsoft and MassChallenge, aims to enhance the local startup ecosystem
item.description:
The Australian government is investing A$280,000 to bring MassChallenge, a leading global startup accelerator, to Australia. The goal is to support the growth of local startups. MassChallenge, in partnership with Microsoft Australia and the Australian government, will offer resources such as idea-pitching competitions, boot camps, and mentoring to strengthen the Australian startup ecosystem. As a non-profit, equity-free accelerator, MassChallenge provides promising startups with the opportunity to compete for millions of dollars in cash awards...

item.title: Some businesses are finding success with crowdfunding
item.description:
Crowdfunding, particularly through platforms like Kickstarter, has proven very successful for certain entrepreneurs. The typical project presents a concept and images of the product in development and seeks funding from backers. Both entrepreneurs and their backers can be located anywhere globally. Funding is usually sought through tiered pledges, where higher pledges receive products with additional features. This process is often gamified with “stretch goals,” where exceeding funding targets unlocks new rewards for all backers at specific milestones...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/some-businesses-are-finding-success-with-crowdfunding/

item.title: Successful demonstration of augmented reality video calls over long distances using 5G technology
item.description:
Source: Singtel. An Optus engineer at Optus’ live 5G site in Sydney, Australia conducts a 5G augmented reality video call using an OPPO 5G test device with Singtel engineers in Singapore. Singtel, Optus, and Ericsson have given a glimpse into the future of communication by making a successful 5G video call with augmented reality (AR) between Singapore and Australia. This call, using OPPO 5G test devices equipped with Qualcomm 5G modems on both countries’ 5G networks, demonstrates the potential of real-time AR on 5G networks built by Ericsson...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/successful-demonstration-of-augmented-reality-video-calls-over-long-distances-using-5g-technology/

item.title: Text Messaging To The Stars
item.description:
Instead of texting Hollywood stars, how about sending a message to another planet? You can join a project called “Hello From Earth,” which sent text messages to Gliese 581d, a planet outside our solar system. Located 20 light years away in the constellation Libra, it will take about 20 years for your message to reach these potential extraterrestrials. While we don’t know who or what might receive our messages, many people chose to send greetings of peace...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/text-messaging-to-the-stars/

item.title: Google is ranked first in the Brandindex Australia rankings for 2016
item.description:
Source: YouGov BrandIndex. Overall brand rankings for 2016 in Australia. YouGov BrandIndex has released its 2016 rankings for Australia. Having monitored brands in Australia since mid-2015, BrandIndex currently tracks over 260 brands. Alphabet’s Google secured the top position, followed by YouTube, another Alphabet subsidiary, and then ALDI, the discount retailer. Here are some other notable findings: In the automotive sector, Toyota, Mazda, and Mercedes-Benz secured the top three spots...

item.title: The Gold Coast, Australia will be home to the first Hyde location outside of the US
item.description:
Accor is expanding its partnership with sbe beyond the US, selecting Australia as the first Asia Pacific location. Hyde, their luxury lifestyle brand known for its Los Angeles Sunset Strip inspiration, will debut Hyde Paradiso on the Gold Coast in March 2019. This venue promises an all-day experience, transforming into a sophisticated lounge and dining destination in the evening. Simon McGrath, COO of Accor Pacific, highlights the partnership’s goal to deliver unique lifestyle experiences...

item.title: Vivid Sydney will once again enchant audiences starting on May 27th
item.description:
The longest-running Vivid Sydney will illuminate Sydney Harbour and other beloved locations for 23 nights, from May 27 to June 18, 2016. This year marks the eighth anniversary of the world’s largest festival of light, music, and ideas. The festival is owned, managed, and produced by Destination NSW, the NSW Government’s tourism and major events agency. Sandra Chipchase, Destination NSW Chief Executive Officer and Executive Producer of Vivid Sydney, stated that this year’s Vivid Sydney promises an incredible program where art, creativity, and innovation converge, captivating both local and international visitors...

item.title: Singapore and Australia provide the fastest mobile data speeds
item.description:
Source: Ericsson South East Asia and Oceania regional Ericsson Mobility Report. According to Ericsson, Singapore is the only Southeast Asian nation with mobile networks strong enough to consistently support high-bandwidth applications, like streaming video, on consumer devices. The November 2015 Ericsson South East Asia and Oceania regional Ericsson Mobility Report states that Singapore is also the region’s first and only country with a smartphone subscription rate exceeding 100%. Both Singapore and Australia can provide high-definition video streaming anywhere their mobile networks reach...

item.title: The Holiday Inn Melbourne on Flinders has reopened
item.description:
The Holiday Inn Melbourne on Flinders has finished renovating all guest rooms, bathrooms, and suites, offering visitors a revitalized stay in the heart of the city. Source: Holiday Inn website. The Holiday Inn Melbourne on Flinders. Every room was completely emptied to give the architect a fresh start in designing a space with the modern traveler’s needs in mind. Striking new interiors are highlighted by floor-to-ceiling windows, equipped with electronically controlled blackout blinds that can be adjusted from the bedside...

item.title: New website offers discounted gym classes in Melbourne
item.description:
Source: FILLMYCLASS. Similar to discounts for last-minute travel bookings, you can find more affordable gym classes at the last minute too. A new website called FILLMYCLASS has launched in Melbourne, Australia. This website connects fitness enthusiasts with open spots in fitness classes at gyms and studios nearby. FILLMYCLASS founder Daniel Waide states, “It’s all about flexibility. The aim is to encourage more people to be active. Offering the ability to select classes that fit their schedule at any gym or studio increases the likelihood of people becoming and staying active...

item.title: Counterfeit software discovered in Singapore sold as authentic in the Asia Pacific region
item.description:
This image depicts a counterfeit Certificate of Authenticity (COA). It only displays the product name and lacks any anti-counterfeiting measures. Microsoft recently uncovered a case of software piracy originating from a supplier in Singapore. The case involved an Australian reseller found to be in possession of fake COAs and other counterfeit software and hardware. COAs are labels or stickers affixed to the packaging of products like Windows, Office, and Windows Server...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/counterfeit-software-discovered-in-singapore-sold-as-authentic-in-the-asia-pacific-region/

item.title: Singapore Airlines' Capital Express Service links Singapore, Canberra, and Wellington
item.description:
Singapore Airlines is launching a new “Capital Express” route, connecting Singapore, Canberra, and Wellington. Starting on September 20, 2016, the airline will offer four weekly flights between these cities, subject to regulatory approval. The route will operate on a Singapore-Canberra-Wellington schedule for outbound flights and a Wellington-Canberra-Singapore schedule for return flights. The flights will utilize retrofitted Boeing 777-200 aircraft, configured with 38 Business Class seats and 228 Economy Class seats. This service marks a significant milestone as it will be Canberra’s first regularly scheduled international service and the first non-stop connection between the capitals of Australia and New Zealand...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singapore-airlines-capital-express-service-links-singapore-canberra-and-wellington/

item.title: Capella Sydney celebrates its first anniversary with joy
item.description:

The offer encompasses: - Daily breakfast at Brasserie 1930 - Exclusive access to The Living Room, a shared area present in every Capella establishment. This space allows guests to participate in daily Capella customs and experience Sydney’s heritage through a curated display of local historical items and art...

item.title: Etihad introduces the Dreamliner to Perth
item.description:
Etihad Airways has started using Boeing 787-9 Dreamliners for flights to Perth, Australia. These planes provide passengers with larger windows, improved air quality, spacious storage, and advanced technology for a more comfortable journey. Flight EY486, the first Dreamliner flight, arrived in Perth on June 2nd and was greeted with a water cannon salute. This daily service replaces the Airbus A330-200, increasing capacity by 14%, with Business Class seating up by 27%...

item.title: In 2017, Etihad will assume control of Virgin's Sydney-Abu Dhabi slots
item.description:
Etihad Airways will increase flights between Abu Dhabi and Sydney to twice daily starting February 6, 2017. Flights EY450 departing Abu Dhabi in the morning and EY451 departing Sydney in the afternoon will now operate seven days a week. This schedule change coincides with strategic partner Virgin Australia’s move to shift its Abu Dhabi operations from Sydney to Perth, effective June 9, 2017. Etihad Airways will expand its current codeshare agreement with Virgin Australia to include their new tri-weekly Perth-Abu Dhabi flights...

item.title: Limited edition experiences are a popular trend in the food service industry in Australia
item.description:
In 2015, Australian diners increasingly embraced their inner foodies, craving novel culinary experiences. Food service operators responded with innovation, experimenting with formats, menus, and dining concepts, according to a Euromonitor blog post. One example highlighted by the research firm is Hotel Marriott in Melbourne’s “Table for 12” concept, launched in October 2015. This exclusive dining experience offered a four-course degustation menu for a limited group of twelve guests, available only one night a week...

item.description:
Many Accor hotels in Australia have received recognition from TripAdvisor for their exceptional service in the tourism and hospitality sector. Several of these hotels were even honored for their fifth consecutive year of outstanding performance, earning them a place in the TripAdvisor Hall of Fame. Six Accor hotels achieved this Hall of Fame distinction this year: The Sebel Melbourne Flinders Lane Quay West Suites Melbourne The Sebel Maroochydore Pullman Palm Cove Sea Temple Resort and Spa Pullman Cairns International The Sebel Mandurah Accor Hotels Australia’s Chief Operating Officer, Simon McGrath, remarked that the variety of Accor brands, locations, and hotels featured in the 2015 TripAdvisor Hall of Fame demonstrates the high quality of the group’s properties across the country...

item.title: Achieving institutional equilibrium and the process of negotiating global treaties
item.description:
Andrés Delgado Casteleiro, Lecturer at Durham Law School Introduction In a ruling on Case C-425/13, Commission v Council, the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) was tasked with clarifying the Council’s authority in providing directions to the Commission during international negotiations. This case, decided on Thursday, specifically concerned the linking of Australia’s emissions trading system with the EU’s and involved examining the balance of power between the Council and the Commission during such negotiations...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/achieving-institutional-equilibrium-and-the-process-of-negotiating-global-treaties/

item.title: How many EU treaties infringe upon the rights to privacy and data protection due to the Domino Effect?
item.description:
Steve Peers The Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) recently made significant rulings on data privacy. In the Digital Rights case, the court struck down the EU’s data retention directive, deeming it mass surveillance lacking adequate safeguards. They also ruled against Google in the “right to be forgotten” case. These decisions have prompted questions about their broader implications. For instance, an Irish court has referred the “Europe v Facebook” case to the CJEU, questioning the compatibility of the EU-US “Safe Harbour” data protection arrangement in light of the Snowden revelations...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-many-eu-treaties-infringe-upon-the-rights-to-privacy-and-data-protection-due-to-the-domino-effect/

item.title: Sage Hotel in West Perth has been opened by Silverneedle
item.description:
Source: Silverneedle. Sage Hotel, West Perth. SilverNeedle, a hotel group based in Singapore, has partnered with Australian Development Capital (ADC), a Perth-based real estate developer, to open a new Sage Hotel in West Perth. This A$35 million project marks the debut of the Sage Hotel brand in Perth, a city gaining popularity among Singaporean business and leisure travelers, and positions the brand within the upscale hotel market. item.title: Australians are worried about the amount of sugar in fizzy drinks
item.description:
Australia’s carbonated soft drink (CSD) market is experiencing ongoing challenges due to consumer worries about sugar content, as reported by Mintel, a global market intelligence firm. Mintel predicts that the total sales volume of CSDs in Australia will likely decrease by 2.3% in 2017, following a 4.7% drop from 2014 to 2016. Mintel’s research suggests that growing awareness of sugar’s negative effects has prompted many Australians to reevaluate their sugar consumption...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/australians-are-worried-about-the-amount-of-sugar-in-fizzy-drinks/

item.title: Accor expands its footprint in regional Queensland with the addition of Mercure Rockhampton
item.description:
The Travelodge Hotel in Rockhampton has transitioned to the Mercure brand as part of a new franchise agreement with Accor. This addition expands Mercure’s presence to over 50 properties in Australia and New Zealand, and more than 810 globally. Conveniently located in the city center and a short distance from the airport, the Mercure Rockhampton underwent renovations in 2008. The eight-story hotel boasts 74 rooms, views of the Fitzroy River, six conference rooms, an outdoor pool, a fitness center, a 24-hour reception, and convenient access to attractions like Great Keppel Island...

Sydney is getting ready for Vivid Sydney, a major festival celebrating light, music, and ideas in the Southern Hemisphere. item.title: Companies that experience data breaches in the Asia Pacific region are unlikely to be forgiven
item.description:
New research from SafeNet reveals that data breaches significantly influence customer trust. The global study, including participants from Japan and Australia, found that 65% wouldn’t patronize a business that experienced a financial data breach, compromising credit card details, bank accounts, or login credentials. SafeNet’s Q2 Breach Level Index reported 237 data breaches from April to June 2014, exposing over 175 million records globally. These findings highlight the impact of data breaches on customer loyalty and revenue...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/companies-that-experience-data-breaches-in-the-asia-pacific-region-are-unlikely-to-be-forgiven/

item.title: Australia, Singapore, and the UAE are among the top 10 destinations on people's relocation wishlist
item.description:
A recent report by Hydrogen Group, a global recruitment firm, reveals a growing trend of professionals seeking international work opportunities. The study found that the number of individuals open to working abroad doubled over a five-year period, rising from 16% in 2010 to 35% in 2014. Furthermore, 40% of respondents believe there are no obstacles to relocating for work. While the US and UK were the most popular destinations, followed by Australia, Singapore ranked as the most preferred Asian country at seventh place...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/australia-singapore-and-the-uae-are-among-the-top-10-destinations-on-people-s-relocation-wishlist/

item.title: Frost & Sullivan anticipates a need for independent analyses to support IPOs
item.description:
A research and consulting firm, Frost & Sullivan, predicts significant growth for the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX) in 2017, with nearly 45 companies already lined up for initial public offerings (IPOs). This positive outlook comes after the ASX saw a stable number of IPOs in 2016, similar to the previous year. Notably, technology and fintech companies made up about 25% of these listings. Frost & Sullivan played a key role in several 2016 ASX IPOs by providing independent market reports (IMRs)...

CoAssets’ platform already facilitates real estate crowdfunding and will now provide a space for SMEs to seek funding. item.description:
Source: Etihad. Etihad Airways has opened its first Australian First and Business Class Lounge at Sydney Airport. The new lounge is the latest addition to the airline’s global network of premium lounges. Situated near Gate 51 in Pier C of the international terminal, the lounge provides a comfortable atmosphere for guests. It features high-quality furnishings and a modern design inspired by Etihad Airways’ flagship lounges in Abu Dhabi. item.title: Australian consumers are pleased to use contactless cards for payment
item.description:
A recent Mastercard survey highlights the increasing popularity of digital payment methods among Australians. Over 80% of Australians use contactless payments, also known as “tap and go,” weekly. This preference is so strong that a significant number of consumers get frustrated when stores don’t offer this option, with some even choosing to shop elsewhere. Supermarkets, retail stores, and petrol stations are the most common places where Australians use contactless cards. Mastercard Australia and New Zealand’s Head of Market Development and Payment Innovation, Garry Duursma, emphasizes that Australians view tap and go as a faster and more convenient payment method...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/australian-consumers-are-pleased-to-use-contactless-cards-for-payment/

item.title: Emirates introduces Airbus A380 to Perth route
item.description:
Starting May 1, 2015, Emirates will introduce its Airbus A380 aircraft to the Perth, Australia route. This upgrade from a Boeing 777-300ER on one of the three daily Dubai-Perth flights signifies Perth’s growth as a global destination. This change will increase capacity by 136 seats per flight and 1,904 seats weekly, highlighting Emirates’ dedication to travelers visiting Western Australia’s capital city. Barry Brown, Emirates’ Divisional Senior Vice President, Commercial Operations - East, emphasized the importance of Australia as a destination by highlighting this fifth Emirates A380 service in partnership with Qantas...

AirAsia X, the long-haul, budget-friendly part of the AirAsia Group, is starting flights to Auckland, New Zealand, from Kuala Lumpur. The route will have a stopover on the Gold Coast of Australia and begins on March 22, 2016. Benyamin Ismail, CEO of AirAsia X, stated that New Zealand is a top-tier destination that the company has always valued. item.title: Is the choice between the EU and the Commonwealth a true dilemma for the UK, or is it a misleading decision?
item.description:
Steve Peers The UK is part of many international organizations: the EU, NATO, the UN Security Council, and the Commonwealth are just a few examples. Out of these, the Commonwealth, which recently held its latest summit, has the strongest ties to British history and culture because it primarily consists of former British colonies. (There are some Commonwealth members that were never colonies, and certain former colonies like the US opted not to join...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-the-choice-between-the-eu-and-the-commonwealth-a-true-dilemma-for-the-uk-or-is-it-a-misleading-decision/

item.title: Check Point warns that free USB devices may be carriers of malware
item.description:
Source: Victoria Police. The unmarked USB drives used are similar to these. On September 21st, law enforcement in Victoria, Australia, issued a warning to residents of Pakenham, a Melbourne suburb, about unlabeled USB drives found in mailboxes. According to the Victoria police statement, people have been discovering unmarked USB drives in their mailboxes. When connected to computers, these drives have exposed victims to fraudulent streaming service offers and other serious problems...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/check-point-warns-that-free-usb-devices-may-be-carriers-of-malware/

item.title: The Autograph Collection is ready to make its first appearance in Australia
item.description:
Australian companies have a new, upscale event location. Pier One Sydney Harbour is joining the Autograph Collection, a curated group of almost 60 unique hotels globally. This harborside hotel provides a picturesque setting for meetings and events, featuring eight meeting rooms with expansive water views. Source: Marriott International. From Sydney to San Diego - Autograph Collection set to debut in three new world class destinations, including Pier One Sydney Harbour in Sydney, Australia...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-autograph-collection-is-ready-to-make-its-first-appearance-in-australia/

item.title: The top goal for urban Australians is to spend more time with their family
item.description:
The increasing presence of technology in everyday life has led many Australians to desire a better work-life balance. Market intelligence agency Mintel reports that 38% of Australians are hoping to achieve this balance in the coming year. Mintel’s research indicates that more than half of Australians living in metropolitan areas (51%) want to prioritize spending time with family in the next year. This desire is even more pronounced in families with three or more members, reaching 60%...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-top-goal-for-urban-australians-is-to-spend-more-time-with-their-family/

item.title: Etihad plans to increase the number of flights between Abu Dhabi and Melbourne
item.description:
Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, will begin offering daily A380 flights between Abu Dhabi and Melbourne starting June 1, 2016. This will affect flight numbers EY460/461, one of the airline’s two daily trips between the cities. This change replaces one of the three-class Boeing 777-300ER aircraft currently used. Passengers can now enjoy The Residence by Etihad, a luxurious private three-room suite, and other cutting-edge products and services across all cabins...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/etihad-plans-to-increase-the-number-of-flights-between-abu-dhabi-and-melbourne/

item.title: Emirates is set to introduce a third daily service to Brisbane
item.description:
Source: Emirates. Plane in Emirates livery. Emirates will begin offering a third daily flight to Brisbane, Australia starting December 1, 2017, adding to their current two daily flights. This direct flight will utilize a Boeing 777-200LR, which boasts eight First Class seats, 42 Business Class seats, and 216 Economy Class seats. This will increase the route’s capacity by 3,724 seats weekly, both to and from Brisbane and Emirates’ Dubai hub...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/emirates-is-set-to-introduce-a-third-daily-service-to-brisbane/

item.title: Hyatt Regency is back in Sydney and is now focusing on positioning the hotel for MICE events
item.description:
Hyatt Hotels announced that a hotel situated at 161 Sussex Street, previously operating under the Four Points by Sheraton brand, will transition to Hyatt Regency Sydney starting November 30, 2016. This change signifies the return of the Hyatt Regency brand to Sydney. The company is strategically positioning the Hyatt Regency Sydney as a prime location for conferences. The introduction of Hyatt Regency Sydney aligns with the growing demand for business, meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions (MICE), as well as leisure travel within the Australian market...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/hyatt-regency-is-back-in-sydney-and-is-now-focusing-on-positioning-the-hotel-for-mice-events/

item.title: CSIRO is expediting promising research through ON Accelerate3
item.description:
The Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) has chosen 10 teams for ON Accelerate3, a nationwide program supporting research projects in Australia. This program began in 2015 to enhance innovation by connecting different fields, industries, science, and business. These teams, representing various institutions like Flinders University and CSIRO, are tackling challenges in areas such as food security and healthcare. CSIRO Chief Executive Dr. Larry Marshall emphasized the diversity of this group, their potential to create new jobs, and their ability to address significant societal issues...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/csiro-is-expediting-promising-research-through-on-accelerate3/

item.title: Monitoring social media shows the sentiments towards Formula One in the Asia Pacific region
item.description:
In July, Microsoft launched Microsoft Social Listening in eight Asia Pacific markets. This service is designed to help professionals in sales, marketing, and customer care understand and engage with customers on social media more effectively. Microsoft Social Listening provides tools for analyzing market intelligence from social conversations, including sentiment analysis across multiple platforms. It also allows users to monitor products, brands, competitors, and campaigns globally in real time to gain a comprehensive understanding of their customers and their business in the social media landscape...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/monitoring-social-media-shows-the-sentiments-towards-formula-one-in-the-asia-pacific-region/

item.title: Ibis Hotels partners with Deezer to create a musical experience
item.description:
Source: Accor Hotels. Ibis Hotels, a budget-friendly option within the Accor group, has launched a new campaign in Australia. Through a partnership with Deezer, a global music streaming platform, guests can now immerse themselves in the world of music. This collaboration gives guests staying at ibis, ibis Styles, and ibis Budget hotels access to ibis PLAY, a dedicated microsite. This platform offers a variety of music-centric content, including regularly updated local concert listings, curated playlists, music news, artist interviews, photo galleries, exclusive ibis content, and a spotlight on Australian live acts...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ibis-hotels-partners-with-deezer-to-create-a-musical-experience/

item.title: Big companies are scaling back, while small businesses remain optimistic for 2016 in China
item.description:
At the start of 2016, business sentiment in China presents a mixed picture. While confidence among large companies has slightly declined, smaller businesses are expressing optimism, according to separate reports from MNI Indicators and CPA Australia. The MNI China Business Sentiment Indicator dipped to 52.3 in January, down from 52.7 in December. Although this still indicates expansion for the second consecutive month, it marks the first month-over-month decrease since November. Businesses have also tempered their future expectations, as reflected in the Future Expectations Indicator’s 0...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/big-companies-are-scaling-back-while-small-businesses-remain-optimistic-for-2016-in-china/

item.title: Come to Vivid Sydney and immerse yourself in the biggest festival of light, music, and ideas in the world
item.description:
Source: Vivid Sydney/Destination NSW. Vivid Sydney, a global festival celebrating light, music, and ideas, will illuminate Sydney until June 8th. Last year, the festival drew in 1.43 million attendees. Stuart Ayres, the NSW Minister for Trade, Tourism and Major Events, highlighted the festival’s ability to transform Sydney for 18 days and nights with creativity and vibrant light displays. He emphasized it as a must-see event for showcasing the city’s pride...

item.title: DHL eCommerce has launched a new Fulfillment Center in Sydney
item.description:
DHL eCommerce, a branch of the logistics giant Deutsche Post DHL Group, has opened a Fulfillment Center in Sydney, Australia. The new center will help the company meet the demands of Australia’s rapidly growing number of online shoppers buying goods from overseas. Damien Sheehan, Managing Director for DHL eCommerce in Australia, highlighted the significance of Australian online shoppers, stating, “Australian shoppers are some of the most frequent buyers from international sellers online, and their influence will only grow as cross-border e-commerce continues to expand at an average rate of 29% annually through 2020...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/dhl-ecommerce-has-launched-a-new-fulfillment-center-in-sydney/

item.title: SilverNeedle Hospitality introduces the new Sage Hotel brand, catering specifically to upscale business travelers
item.description:
SilverNeedle Hospitality, headquartered in Singapore, has introduced a new upscale hotel brand, Sage Hotel, tailored for business travelers. The first Sage Hotel will be located in Brisbane, Australia. Iqbal Jumabhoy, Managing Director & Group Chief Executive Officer at SilverNeedle Hospitality, stated, “We recognize a significant group of business travelers seeking a consistent and straightforward experience while working in unfamiliar cities.” He added, “Sage Hotel is designed to meet their needs and complements our existing portfolio of six brands...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/silverneedle-hospitality-introduces-the-new-sage-hotel-brand-catering-specifically-to-upscale-business-travelers/

item.title: Every night in Sydney, it's Lights On for Vivid Sydney!
item.description:
Source: Destination NSW. Vivid Sydney in action. The tenth anniversary of Vivid Sydney, the world’s largest festival of light, music and ideas, has begun. As Australia’s largest event, Vivid Sydney transforms the city into a captivating display of illumination, sound, and creativity. The festival commenced with the symbolic ‘Lights On’ moment, with all eyes on the Sydney Opera House for the ‘Lighting of the Sails’. This year’s display, created by Australian artist Jonathan Zawada, featured dynamic digital sculptures of commonplace objects and elements from nature, morphing and changing before the viewers’ eyes...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/every-night-in-sydney-it-s-lights-on-for-vivid-sydney/

item.title: In May 2015, SilkAir will begin operating flights to Cairns, Australia
item.description:
SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, will begin offering direct flights between Singapore and Cairns, Queensland, Australia, starting May 30, 2015, pending regulatory approval. Cairns will be the airline’s second Australian destination after Darwin, which launched in March 2012. SilkAir intends to operate the Cairns route three times a week on Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays, through circular routings with Darwin. The inaugural flight and subsequent Saturday flights will depart Singapore for Cairns non-stop, returning to Singapore via Darwin...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/in-may-2015-silkair-will-begin-operating-flights-to-cairns-australia/

item.title: TeamAhoy introduces a new project management software that focuses on people
item.description:
Source: TeamAhoy. Bramanis. TeamAhoy (previously known as Birds Eye View), an Australian company, has introduced the first public version of its project management software. The startup highlights that its software differentiates itself by prioritizing the human element, unlike competitors. Founder Damian Bramanis explains that while teams consist of people, most project management tools don’t reflect this in their design. He believes TeamAhoy stands out by offering managers a user-friendly platform that centers around individuals...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/teamahoy-introduces-a-new-project-management-software-that-focuses-on-people/

item.title: The Fuel & Trip Calculator from Bayswater Car Rentals eliminates the need for guessing petrol budgets
item.description:
To help people budget for fuel costs and travel time, Bayswater Car Rentals (BCR) has introduced the Fuel & Trip Calculator. This online tool is available to everyone, not just BCR customers. Arnold Kluck, CEO of BCR, explained that the company was founded to provide budget-friendly car rentals. He noted that customers frequently underestimate petrol costs at the end of their rental period, as it’s easy to overlook this expense during travel planning...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-fuel-trip-calculator-from-bayswater-car-rentals-eliminates-the-need-for-guessing-petrol-budgets/
